p: With the arrival of the COVID-19 epidemic in early 2020, government and industry sponsors scrambled to launch clinical trials to evaluate interventions that might favorably impact COVID-19 disease, including products already approved for use in other indications and others being newly developed [ [10], [11], [12], [13]]. These trials have largely followed the traditional clinical trial structure, including the use of DMCs that are guided by best practices based on decades of experiences [ 4]. From our initial experiences, there are some emerging challenges that DMCs will have to address to meet both ethical and scientific needs.
